intro: Machaerina resinosa, commonly known as the silver tree, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. It is adapted to grow in coastal and inland areas with well-drained soils. Machaerina resinosa is also known for its ability to tolerate salt spray and strong winds, making it a hardy species in its native habitat.
